citeinfo.origin: North Carolina State University, Center for Earth Observation
citeinfo.title: Colonial National Historical Park Vegetation Mapping Project - Color Infrared Orthorectified Photomosaic Leaf-off

descript.abstract: Orthorectified color infrared ERDAS Imagine image of Colonial National Historical Park. Produced from 280 color infrared photos taken March 1, 2002. Orthorectification accomplished with Imagine Orthobase v8.5 software. RMSE is 0.943 meters meeting class 1 NMAS. The spring mosaics for Colonial NHP are broken into 5 pieces. The 5 individual pieces are listed as follows: greenspring_sp, jamestown_swannpt_sp, parkway_ringfield_sp, williamsburg_sp, and yorktown_sp.
descript.purpose: The dataset was developed for use by Colonial NHP as a GIS component and for digital monoplotting and mapping.

spdom.descgeog: Colonial National Historical Park and environs

idinfo.native: ERDAS Imagine IMG File and Mr. SID Compressed File

dataqual.complete: Colonial National Historical Park and surrounding area

horizpa.horizpar: Overall positional accuracy of 0.943 meters based on root mean square error meets the NMAS Class 1 map standard. Horizontal accuracy was assessed on the basis of 65 field survey points distributed throughout the image. The actual field coordinates for these points were recorded with a Trimble ProXRS GPS unit with real-time differential correction with a minimum of 180 fixes per point. The field coordinates were then post-processed using differential correction. The field coordinates were then compared to the image mosaic coordinates for these points, determined in ESRI ArcView 3.3 software.

citeinfo.title: 30 Meter Digital Elevation Model- USGS National Elevation Dataset

procstep.procdesc: The photos (280 total) were used to create an orthorectified mosaic using ERDAS Imagine. The photos were scanned at 600 dpi and imported into Imagine. The DEMs were resampled from 30 meters to 10 meters in ArcInfo Workstation using cubic convolution and then mosaicked together. If the mosaicked DEMs had gaps, they were then run in ArcInfo Workstation using a focal mean. The images were orthorectified using ERDAS Imagine Orthobase software. Airborne GPS and IMU data were used in the aerial triangulation procedure. Aerial triangulation produced a single RMSE of less than 1 meter for the entire block of photos. The orthorectified images were then mosaiced within Imagine or Er Mapper to form one seamless basemap image for Colonial National Historical Park. The mosaic was compressed using MrSID software at a 1:20 target compression ratio.

cntaddr.address: NCSU, Center For Earth Observation NCSU Campus Box 7106

overview.eaover: Dataset consists of a raster 3 band color image. The bands are blue, green and near infrared. Each pixel contains a value between 0 - 255.

This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.
